data.name: trader
data.description: Search the trader for items. This command is the heart of the bot, it's a combination of multiple different ways to display items. Select an option in the autocomplete menu for detailed item information, or don't select any options to query the item database for that specific name

options.name: search-query
options.description: The query to search Trader items for

data.name: debug
data.description: Display detailed debugging information for a specific item. This is currently only supported for the Expansion Market module. This debug information might be requested by developers to assist with bug reports.

options.name: search
options.description: The autocomplete query for the item you want to debug

options.name: include-output
options.description: Should the normal /trader output be displayed

options.name: debug-base
options.description: Should the item base debugging information be displayed

options.name: debug-stock
options.description: Should the item stock debugging information be displayed

options.name: debug-trader
options.description: Should the item trader debugging information be displayed

options.name: debug-trader-zone
options.description: Should the item trader zone debugging information be displayed

data.name: item-list
data.description: Display a link to the website guide explaining how to configure in-game names for a server

data.name: set-item-list
data.description: Set your item-list file. Requires init.c modifications. Use /item-list for more information

options.name: item-list-export
options.description: Your items-export.json. Use /item-list for more information

data.name: remove-item-list
data.description: Wipe your in-game item list data. Can be used if you no longer want to use in-game names instead of class names.

data.name: set-market-config
data.description: Set your Expansion Market config (zipped server/profile/ExpansionMod/Market folder). These files hold your item categorization and item stat defaults, and are therefor required by the client to function properly.

data.name: set-market-map
data.description: Set your Expansion Market trader maps (zipped mpmissions/expansion/traders folder). These files hold your trader map data, and is required in order to check which trader zone a specific trader is located in.

data.name: set-market-traders
data.description: Set your Expansion Market traders (zipped profiles/ExpansionMod/Traders folder). These files hold your individual trader configurations, and are therefor essential to function properly.

data.name: set-market-zones
data.description: Set your Expansion Market zones (zipped mpmissions/expansion/traderzones folder). These files hold your configuration for your trader zones, prices and locations can't be displayed accurately without this, and it's therefor required to function properly

data.name: set-trader-plus-file
data.description: Set your TraderPlus config file, this file is called TraderPlusPriceConfig.json and contains all your item prices (with categorization) configuration

data.name: set-trader-plus-ids
data.description: Set your TraderPlusIDsConfig file. This file contains the information required to know what categories traders sell, optional.

data.name: remove-trader-plus-ids
data.description: Wipe your TraderPlusIDsConfig data. You should never have to use this, only used if you don't want the additional item information.

data.name: set-trader-plus-general-config
data.description: Set your TraderPlusGeneralConfig file. This file is used to take your currency into consideration and let's the bot display trader locations.

data.name: remove-plus-general-config
data.description: Wipe your TraderPlusGeneralConfig data. You should never have to use this, only used if you don't want the additional item information

data.name: set-trader-file
data.description: Set your Trader (by Dr. Jones) config file. The Trader module is the oldest, and simplest, available in this bot and therefor only requires 1 file upload to function properly.

data.name: commands
data.description: Navigates users to this command table; This command will display a link to this command overview

data.name: help
data.description: Display general information about the bot. Displays your trader type, item-list status, and links to important information like the website, command overview, donation, contact, and support

data.name: ping
data.description: Displays API latency, bot latency, uptime, system stats, and user/server count

data.name: stats
data.description: Display bot stats. This command is an exact copy (or alias) of /ping

data.name: support
data.description: Receive support for the bot. Invites you to a Discord server which should be used for: Bugs, feedback, feature requests, suggestions, the open-beta, and update notifications.
